function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Inadequate utilization of urine proteomics for disease biomarkers","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited integration of urinary biomarkers in wastewater-based epidemiology wbe","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Challenges in assessing polio through sewage samples","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Variability in efficiency of dna/rna extraction from pcr inhibitor rich samples","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty in the suitability of dpcr for certain sample types","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of wastewater to detect pathogenic organisms may lead to misinterpretation of disease prevalence in the community.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High mutation rates of rna viruses may lead to rapid adaptation and spread in new host populations.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Historical data from wastewater surveillance may not accurately predict future disease outbreaks.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Sewage system containing complex microbial communities","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of water fingerprinting for community-wide infectious disease diagnostics","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Wide array of endogenous chemical and biological urinary biomarkers linked with disease","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty in population size making it challenging to monitor the emergence of infections within a community from wastewater","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limitations of wastewater-based epidemiology wbe techniques for biomarker selection","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Difficulties in estimating population size of individual wwtp catchments","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Influence of wastewater composition on hydrochemical parameters","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainties associated with sample collection and analytical variability","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Possible transmission of contagious diseases through wastewater and surface diseases","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exposure to endogenous biomarkers may reveal information about community health status and disease prevalence","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Possible transmission of contagious diseases through untreated wastewater","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential contamination of water sources with harmful chemicals or biological compounds.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of accurate interpretation of biomarkers in wastewater, leading to misrepresentation of community health and lifestyle habits.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate surveillance of multiple diseases, including rare ones, in built environments","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient environmental monitoring of potential hazards in built environments","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of comprehensive data collection on the emergence and re-emergence of diseases, and threat of drug-resistant
